name: Ignis
info: A Sinner adept at Magic Output. Can deal 5% more Damage, and an extra 5% more for enemies with broken Cores.
criminalRecord:
The culprit of a large-scale serial arson case who had already caused multiple fires in several Eastside residential areas years ago. During the arrest, the subject burned down three street blocks, injuring many people and causing massive property damage.

Escaped from the detainment during a riot, but turned herself in after staying briefly in Eastside for unknown reasons. The subject is suspected to pose a safety threat.

--

Proper public awareness of Sinners had not yet been formed when the incident happened, which resulted in severe emotional repression in the subject during her formative years. The lack of specialized Sinner detention and training institutions at the time also led to the outburst of the Sinner's special power after she was harassed, which in turn resulted in the accident.

The retrieved MBCC records reveal that the subject was ushered out by the crowd during the riot and did not escape on her own account.
mutationAssessment:
+++* Ability Summary
Able to make any substance within a ten-meter radius combust instantly. When the subject is emotionally unstable, the ability will go out of control and create highly destructive blazes that are hard to extinguish across a wide area.

+++* Awakening Signs
During a culinary accident in her childhood, the subject grew fretful and furious due to an operational mistake and triggered their special power, incinerating the entire kitchen. Since the incident happened long ago, the precise awakening trigger cannot be determined.

+++* Corruption State
Though the subject's special power is unstable and highly destructive, her signs of corruption are rather inconspicuous. The subject sometimes calls for her parents in her dreams, displaying mild sleep-talking symptoms.
interrogation1:
The Chief brings Ignis into the interrogation room for a chat over the arson case that she's involved in. Ignis believes there's no reason to talk about it claiming that she's the culprit. The Chief isn't convinced, but Ignis is become agitated over their inquiries. So, the Chief changes their approach to break the ice, and in turn revealing that they know that Ignis has a food blog. While Ignis gets angry enough to cause a combustion she apologizes as if it were an accident. This small outburst confirms the Chief's suspicion that Ignis loses control of her ability when her emotions are high. Ignis reveals that writing her blog is what gave away her Sinner identity and she blames herself. After reassuring her the Chief asks with hesitation if two people who went missing that day were her parents. Ignis gets furious and nearly loses control, but that doesn't stop the Chief's suspicions.

Your interrogation is successful. From the information, you learned that there is another criminal case where Ignis is involved, and that is the serial arsonist of Eastside. Since then, she hasn't demonstrated any viscous behaviors. Though you are certain that she is still hiding something, you don't know for sure if that something is a threat or just a scar from her past.
interrogation2:
The Chief finds Ignis in the kitchen after an alert. She had attempted to cook likely from hunger, so the Chief offers to help her prepare a steak. The Chief figures out that Ignis worked at her parent's restaurant, but often doesn't cook because fire makes her own fire go out of control. Ignis becomes cautious as Chief asks again about her parents wanting get to know more about her. Ignis reveals that she gave herself up to the FAC under the condition that her family stay unimplicated so they aren't known for raising a Sinner. A sacrifice in a way since they sacrificed so much for her upending their own lives to better accommodate her. They were relatively happy, Ignis even feeling normal as she went about life with her family and writing her blog. While Ignis blames herself for ruining everything the Chief reassures her that her parents picked themselves back up. Ignis knows all these details including that they have new daughter, a normal one unlike her. Ignis wants to let them be, so they can have normal life, and while she sheds no tears they only seem be held back.

She came here of her own accord and became what others called a monster. It is for herself but also for her parents. It's like a recovering wound. The blood coagulates, but the scab still stings when you touch it.
interrogation3:
The Chief takes Ignis out for a walk, but little does she know is that the Chief brings them to a restaurant across from her parent's new restaurant. While Ignis is terrified at the vicinity she's in of her family and angry at the Chief she doesn't want to leave. Ignis becomes placid as she looks on at her family's restaurant. The Chief orders two creme brulee getting Ignis to recall a story of her burning down garage trying to make the same dish somehow getting a burned one that survived it and earning the nickname Fire-kissed Creme Brulee. With sudden happenstance The Chief reveals that the creme brulee they ordered spells out Ignis. Ignis breaks out into quiet sobs knowing fully well that this dish, Ignis's Kiss, was a quiet letter to her that they never forgot her. After finishing up and being reminded by Nightingale that it was time Ignis timidly asks if they could come back. The Chief silently nods yes.

I should just be a "Restrainer."
arrestRec1: During the MBCC's investigation of the severe fire in the food festival, the subject approached the MBCC and revealed her Sinner identity, turning herself in on the spot.
arrestRec2: The subject's parents are both famous cooks in their local region and cook highly acclaimed dishes. To help cover up the subject's Sinner identity, her parents even gave up their careers and relocated several times.
arrestRec3: Since the subject has zero gift for cooking, her parents encouraged her to nurture a food reviewing hobby after school. She's set up a food review social media account named //CrÃ¨me BrÃ»lÃ©e Official// and has gained a substantial following. The blog is currently on hiatus.
arrestRec4: Some rude fans once tried to probe the subject's personal information and managed to find her location and trespassed into her home. This behavior directly caused an emotional breakdown in the subject which resulted in a fire.
servingTerm1: The fireproof room the MBCC's specifically prepared for her has made her the center of attention among all the Sinners. She's even gained a new nickname //Apple Peel// because of her unique hairstyle. Although the subject appears annoyed by this nickname, she's sneakily changed her social media profile picture to an apple.
servingTerm2: A foodie and especially obsessed with the crÃ¨me brÃ»lÃ©e sold at a certain shop. Every time when she comes back from a mission, she asks the Chief for a pudding. This is one of her few interests she's willing to let others know about and she appears surprisingly enthusiastic about it.
servingTerm3: Exceptionally passionate about cooking. Have snuck into unguarded kitchen to attempt to cook many times, but every time it ended in a fire in the kitchen. The subject is puzzled by this as well, thinking she should make an excellent chef now that she can perfectly control her combustion ability.
servingTerm4: After 36 small-scale fires in the kitchen, the subject finally succeeded in making her first finished product, a crÃ¨me brÃ»lÃ©e whose recipe originated from her favorite shop.

**Chief:** ......

**Chief:** ......

supervision1:
++* âš  Heat Warning

//There seems to be something wrong with the Energy Furnace's temperature.//

**System Notifications:** The temperature is unusual in the Energy Furnace's vicinity. You asked the employees and realized it was just Ignis training to keep her power under control.

* **Prompt:** Make sure to report first next time.
supervision2:
++* âš  Maintaining Course

//You discovered an open magazine on a chair in the Outdoor Activity Area.//

**System Notifications:** On a chair in the Outdoor Activity Area, there is an open cuisine magazine. And the first column comes from "CrÃ¨me BrÃ»lÃ©e_Official."

* **Prompt:** Give the magazine back to Ignis
supervision3:
++* âš  Maintaining Persona

//Ignis seems to be looking at something.//

**System Notifications:** On one side of the Outdoor Activity Area, Ignis is staring at a few pictures of large dogs on the wall. Upon noticing that you are next to her, she quickly looked away from the pictures, pretending she was just enjoying the view.

* **Prompt:** Walk away
supervision4:
++* âš âš  Fire Drill

//The Bureau holds a fire drill. Ignis is invited onstage to help.//

**System Notifications:** The Bureau is holding a fire drill. To demonstrate how to use a fire extinguisher, Ignis is asked to make some fire.

**Ignis:** Um... Chief, I'm worried I can't control the flame properly.

* **Prompt:** Encourage her

**Chief:** it's alright, you only need to make a small one. You can do it, Ignis! Don't get too nervous.

**Ignis:** Okay, I'll try. Don't be nervous, don't be nervous...

**System Notifications:** The fire Ignis makes devours the entire demonstration venue and the fire drill ends up a failure.

**Ignis:** ...I'm sorry.
supervision5:
++* âš âš  Special Comment

//Someone has published an article on the Bureau's intranet under the name// CrÃ¨me BrÃ»lÃ©e_Official.

**System Notifications:** When you're having your meal, you notice someone has published an article on the Bureau's internal forum under the name //CrÃ¨meBrÃ»lÃ©e_Official.//

**System Notifications:** You click on it and find that it's indeed Ignis's work.

**Ignis:** Hello, Dear readers. It's been a while. Today, I'm bringing you a special review...

**Ignis:** A review of the food in the Minos Bureau of Crisis Control!

**Ignis:** What do the Sinners eat every day? Is it different from food outside?

**Ignis:** We'll begin with today's lunch. Let's have a taste of it.

**Ignis:** First, the mashed potato on the side. The cook was obviously trying to give it a refreshing texture by mixing in an equal portion of blended steamed spinach. This helps lighten the mashed potato's overly sticky texture before and makes the taste more pleasant.

**Ignis:** Next, we have the main dish, a steak. Due to reasons we all know, steaks in the Bureau have always had an unsatisfactory texture and freshness. But the cook made a bold decision to make the steak well done and neutralized the dryness and bitterness with a sweet-and-sour sauce, which was a thoughtful approach.

**Ignis:** Last, the salad. Limited by ingredients, its composition and seasoning are the same as before. However, it seems that the kitchen has switched to a better supplier, since the freshness of the vegetables and fruits is now a notch higher. The salad finally has the crispiness and freshness it ought to have.

**Ignis:** All in all, the Bureau's food rating has gone from a previously failing score to above D+ now. Given the kitchen's current condition, it's a huge leap forward.

* **Prompt:** It makes me hungry.

**System Notifications:** Having read Ignis's review, the food before you seems tastier now.
supervision6:
++* âš âš âš  Someone Who Gets It

//Ignis asks you about the new cook in the Bureau.//

**System Notifications:** Ignis chats with you about the new cook in the Bureau.

**Ignis:** Chief, has the Bureau hired a new cook recently?

* **Prompt:** Express surprise

**Chief:** You can even tell that from the taste?

**Ignis:** Yes. The new cook prefers a lighter taste and purposely puts less seasoning in the food.

**Ignis:** Also, the new cook likes to show their personal style, so sometimes they don't strictly follow the recipes.

**Ignis:** But every Monday, their cooking quality dips slightly. I'm not sure why.

**Ignis:** Perhaps the cook really hates Mondays.

* **Prompt:** Express confusion
 * **Chief:** I thought you hated the Bureau's cafeteria.
 * **Ignis:** Not really. Of course, food in the Bureau is lacking in many aspects, but I'm not gonna blame the cooks for that.
 * **Ignis:** After all, a real food critic only focuses on critiquing the food itself.
 * **Ignis:** Besides, this cook is already doing their best under this very limited condition. I've even written a review about that. Have you not read it yet, Chief?

* **Prompt:** Arrange a meeting
 * **System Notifications:** You tell her you can arrange for the two of them to meet. The cook has already read the food reviews Ignis published on the Intranet and has been singing praises.
 * **Ignis:** W-what?!
 * **Ignis:** I don't think that's necessary. A food critic doesn't always have to meet the food's creator.
 * **Ignis:** Right, to keep my reviews impartial, I'd better not have a personal relationship with the cook.
baseVoicelines:
[Obtain the Sinner]
An arsonist stands before you. Put me behind bars if you can.

[Raise to Phase 1]
My flames burn ever brighter.

[Raise to Phase 3]
I won't lose to it again. From now on, I shall command the flames.

[Level Start]
As long as I can protect those who I love...

[Win Battles]
But everything has been burnt clean.

[Lose Battles]
No... no... I've lost control...!

[Ultimate Skill]
Taste the wrath of fire!

[Die in Battles]
The flames... devoured everything after all...

[Greeting]
Did you... come here just to see me? Um... did you bring some crÃ¨me brÃ»lÃ©e?

[Conversation 1]
Whoa! Do you... do you know what happened to me attackers?

[Conversation 2]
Stay away from me! I won't pay your medical fees if you get burned.

[Conversation 3]
My hair looks weird, doesn't it? It looks like it's on fire... Many fear me because of it, but they don't know what flames really look like.

[Special Conversation 1]
I won't randomly combust! Don't try it anymore!

[Special Conversation 2]
I hope that everyone I love can be happy and safe... why are you looking at me like that? If you'd like, I'll add you to that category.

[Special Conversation 3]
After fighting side by side with you for so long, I can now believe that this power can bring happiness to others...

[Full Compliance]
Someday, when this is all over, I want to make crÃ¨me brÃ»lÃ©e again with my own two hands... Will you be the first to give it a taste?

[Idle]
Is the bakery we passed by earlier about to release new products...?

[Annoyed]
Are you treating me like a log? Drilling wood for fire?

[Special Attention]
No need to watch me like that. My hair makes me stick out enough already. I won't run away.

[Dispatch]
You want some info about food?

[Dispatch Complete]
I included a food review. Ahem, I just made it.

[Level Up]
Be careful, or the fire will go wild again.
attireVoicelines1:
[Attire Obtained]
Is everyone excited about staying up on New Year's Eve? Ahem...Honestly, I'm not that excited. I just happen to be wearing clothes I don't usually wear.

[Greeting]
Gotta try some new things in the new year. I... I've invited you over because I want you to try... the new flavor of my pudding.

[Ordinary Contact 1]
I... It's been a while, and I've made some progress! The Bureau's kitchen is in perfect shape! Even the fire alarm... hasn't been triggered...

[Ordinary Contact 2]
I recreated braised meatballs, mapo tofu, and dumplings all with pudding! You must finish each and everyone of them!

[Ordinary Contact 3]
My mum used to braid my hair when I was little. I think this looks quite festive. What do you think? Does it look good?

[Ordinary Contact 4]
The lady in the library once told me a traditional tale. In the story, the queen has a fan that makes flames covering a whole mountain... I wonder if mine works like that too...?

**Trivia: the story referred to is Journey to the West, during the Flame Mountain arc where they had to obtain the Palm Leaf Fan in order to cross the mountain.

[Idle] 
"Springtime lethargy" is quite common... But hey, don't start on the first day of the new year! ...Anyway, if you're sleepy, j-just find a spot and take a nap here.

[Special Attention] 
Why are you staring at me? Just say it if you don't like this outfit! So I didn't have to... What do you mean you love it?! Hump... You really are...

[Level Up}
Ah! ...Didn't you say you wanted to see some fireworks? I just set some off for you.

[Pat Head]
Wah... You... Forget it! It's a happy day today. I'll let it slide.

exclusiveCrimebrand.name: Ashes to Ashes
exclusiveCrimebrand.description: While [Overload Spark] lasts, each of Ignis's Normal Attack has a 20%/25%/30% chance to summon 1 extra Meteorite to attack enemies.

crimebrandSets.name: Boss Burst
crimebrandSets.note: Increase damage dealt to enemies that are corebroken. Good for BFL and TOA.

crimebrandSets.name: Solo dance
crimebrandSets.note: Increase normal attack damage dealt when not close to the enemy. To increase ultimate damage, move her closer to the enemy and then back again.

crimebrandSets.name: Cheap Alternative
crimebrandSets.note: A very cheap alternative if you have none of the other options available.

shackles.title: Conflagration
shackles.description: [Overload Spark] Effect duration is extended by 3 seconds.

shackles.title: Eternal Flame
shackles.description: Ignis gains a 4% Attack bonus uses after using [Overload Spark], capped at 3 stacks and lasts for the rest of the battle.

shackles.title: Emotion Resonance
shackles.description: Ultimate Energy Consumption is reduced by 3 points.

skills.name: Blaze
skills.description: Ignis spews Blaze, dealing (74% of Attack damage) Magic Damage each hit.

skills.name: Overload Sparks
skills.description: Ignis breaks the limits, turning "Blaze" into "Meteorite" for 12 seconds. Upon landing, a meteorite deals (160% of her Attack) Magic Damage to all enemies within a cross area. During the effect, which she can't automatically recover her energy.

skills.name: Storm of Flames
skills.description: After attacking with "Blaze" or "Meteorite" 5 times, Ignis summons 1 extra meteorite, dealing (100% of her Attack) Magic Damage to enemies within 1 grid.

skills.name: Uncontrollable Blaze
skills.description: On hit, "Meteorite" starts to "Burn" the enemies, dealing (15%) Magic Damage per second for 5 seconds.

compliance: Unlock Voice: Special Conversation 1, Attack +6, Unlock Requirements: Use non-support Ignis to destroy 100 enemies
Unlock File: Performance in Serving Term
Unlock Voice: Special Conversation 3, Unlock Requirements: Ignis Rank is raised to 2
Unlock File: Performance in Serving Term, Unlock Sticker
Unlock File: Surveillance Record, Unlocked voice: Obedience full, Unlock Sinner Title: Unbalanced Flames
attireVoicelines2:
[Attire Obtained]
Uh, you must do it like this! Keep stirring as you say your wish out loud... D-don't worry, I won't tell anyone about your wish. I'll guard it as our little secret.

[Greeting]
We made this Christmas pudding together. No... no matter how the taste turns out, you'll finish it, right?

[Ordinary Contact 1]
Every year around this time, Mom and Dad would deck the kitchen with these kinds of decorations. I tried to recreate what the holidays felt like at my home... What do you think?

[Ordinary Contact 2]
What... what are you standing around for? The Sinner who gave me the recipe said that stirring the batter and making wishes together is the most important step! I... I'm only reminding you because you're clearly going to mess it up, hmph!

[Idle] 
Mmph... the presentation is perfect. The sweetness is just right. The texture is well-balanced too. Miss Faye didn't trick me with substandard stuff this time... But both types of dried fruit are so delicious, which one should I use... Eh?! Where did the rest go?!

[Annoyed]
This Christmas sweater feels good to the touch, doesn't it? So soft and warm. It reminds me of the sweaters Mom used to knit for me when I was little. They were heavy and unfashionable, but every time I wore them I felt like my mom was giving me a big hug.

[Special Attention] 
You keep staring at my hair accessory. Are you craving gingerbread? It just so happens that I've written a bakery review rating their gingerbread. Check it out if you want... You think it's cute? W-well, your taste is not that bad then.

[Level Up}
The bigger the fire, the more likely the wish will come true!

voicelines.Attire Obtained - EN: Is everyone excited about staying up on New Year's Eve? Ahem... Honestly, I'm not that excited. I just happen to be wearing clothes I don't usually wear!

voicelines.Attire Obtained - EN: Uh, you must do it like this! Keep stirring as you say your wish out loud... D-don't worry, I won't tell anyone about your wish. I'll guard it as our little secret.

voicelines.Ordinary Contact 1 - EN: Every year around this time, Mom and Dad would deck the kitchen with these kinds of decorations. I tried to recreate what the holidays felt like at my home... What do you think?

voicelines.Idle - EN: Mmph... The presentation is perfect. The sweetness is just right. The texture is well-balanced too. Miss Faye didn't trick me with substandard stuff this time... But both types of dried fruit are so delicious, which one should I use... Eh?! Where did the rest go?!

voicelines.Annoyed - EN: This Christmas sweater feels good to the touch, doesn't it? So soft and warm. It reminds me of the sweaters Mom used to knit for me when I was little. They were heavy and unfashionable, but every time I wore them I felt like my mom was giving me a big hug.
